channel.title: blender being a bitch
channel.description: ok i have another problem (sigh* i know) im almost done with my model so i save it as a.blend so i can get back to it later i close it out come back later open up the file and now i cant go into edit mode it jsut stays in object mode.. please help

item.title: blender being a bitch
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
I’ve been using Blender since 2007. Protip: if you ask an incredibly vague question on a forum and ignore requests for clarification, and then post a week later blubbering and whinging like Glen Beck’s redheaded stepdaughter about how nobody will help you, you can pretty much expect this quality of response, on any forum.

Read full topic

item.title: blender being a bitch
item.dc:creator: Iblis
item.description:
mattemuse:

The title for this thread should be “Iblis being a bitch.” Seriously dude, do you actually model or do you just like to make threads complaining about it?

I’m trying to model, i didn’t know what seams were at the time. So sorry for my “ignorance” you can all continue bashing me for things I’m trying to learn. next time i wont go barging off to a forum to see if someone could help me, someone thats been using blender for a year or 2… ill just scrape off Google till i find my answer. your “wisdom” has been very helpful.

Read full topic

item.title: blender being a bitch
item.dc:creator: Guf
item.description:
Also it’s not the programmers who set the price, it’s the marketing department that keeps selling features we haven’t built yet…!

Read full topic

item.title: blender being a bitch
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

What kind of dickweed programmer makes a modeling program cost more than a home computer?

I’d understand if computers had the ability to send users into itself to race against programs on lightbikes or something, but damn.

*Programmers. The people who make 3Ds max are a pretty big company (saw them when I went to San Fran, never went inside, but they had a big building). They put a lot of resources into making that program, and the only people who buy it are companies who really need it (pixar, animation studios, architects, etc), so they don’t make a whole lot of sales. The price makes sense compared to how many sales they really make.

Read full topic

item.title: blender being a bitch
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
The title for this thread should be “Iblis being a bitch.” Seriously dude, do you actually model or do you just like to make threads complaining about it?

item.title: blender being a bitch
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
Any professional software can cost thousands (or even tens of thousands :o )
Modelling and CAD programs come to mind, but also editing tools such as Adobe Premiere, or probably some sound mixing programs (that I don’t know anything about).

So yeah, they cost more than a HOME computer, but for a business, 5000$ to make projects that they’ll sell millions is nothing.

I think the most expansive programs are probably simulation programs… a lot are custom-made, and the amount of engineering put into making them is huge. You know, the kind of programs they’d use to simulate a nuclear reactor, stuff like that.

Read full topic

item.title: blender being a bitch
item.dc:creator: Guf
item.description:
There’s all sorts of software out there that costs heaps. 3D Modeling software is only one example, albeit a good one.

item.title: blender being a bitch
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
Schools get some profit out of it, either directly or indirectly

They ‘create’ graduates who know ‘stuff’ and tag them with their name (read Curriculum Vitae) , which gives them a reputation, which brings them students, which makes them money.

They also get educative licenses cheaper, because the software companies apply the same principle… they make more money with the more people there are who knows how to use their program.

Read full topic

item.title: blender being a bitch
item.dc:creator: Guf
item.description:
The (2 Year) 3D Animation course I took taught us most of the Adobe products (Photoshop, Premier, AfterEffects), and most of Maya, and it’s got a lot in it… The only parts we didn’t learn were the expensive addon parts like Fur, Fluids etc.

Read full topic

item.title: blender being a bitch
item.dc:creator: Guf
item.description:
I once made my own UV unwrapping script, for Maya, that pretty much just did a planar mapping per face at a globally fixed scale. Then I could manually and fairly quickly stitch those together to get optimal coverage with minimal warping… 8)
